channel.title: Applied Regression Analysis on STAT 564 Fall 2018
channel.description: Recent content in Applied Regression Analysis on STAT 564 Fall 2018

item.description: Note: The schedule of topics and assignments might be subject to change. Date Lesson Reading Assignment Lecture Lab Part 1: Introduction & Data Analysis Workflow 09/24 Introduction and Data Analysis Workflow Part 2: Linear Regression 10/02 Bivariate Regression 10/09 DEADLINE: Project proposal 10/09 Multiple Regression (1) 10/16 Multiple Regression (2) 10/23 Dummy Variables 10/30 Interactions 11/06 Non-Linear Relationship, Indirect Effects and Omitted Variable Bias 11/13 DEADLINE: Project update 11/13 Outliers, Heteroskedasticity, and Multicollinearity 11/17 DEADLINE: Assignment 2 Part 3: Generalized Linear Models 11/20 Generalized Linear Models I 11/27 Generalized Linear Models; Where to go next 12/4 DEADLINE: Project Presentation 12/8 DEADLINE: Project Report

item.title: Policies
item.description: Grading Policy and Conversion Guidelines for % Grade to Letter Grade: The overall grade will be calculated using formula displayed in the Table 1. The current grade is displayed in D2L so the students can monitor their achievements at any time. Table 1 Activity % In-class Midterm Exam 20 Outside-of-class Final Exam 30 Homework 50 Score (%) Letter Grade Score (%) Letter Grade Score (%) Letter Grade 93-100 A 87-89 B+ 77-79 C+ 90-92 A- 83-86 B 73-76 C 80-82 B- 70-72 C- (In order to receive a Pass with the Pass/No Pass option, a grade of C or better must be earned.

item.title: Notes
item.description: Demonstration interactive visualization Interpreting Confidence Intervals Interpreting Cohen's d effect size Interpreting Correlations Understanding Statistical Power and Significance Testing Cheatsheets Equations: Z test Z test is a this link T test T test is an here X X is an here Y Y is an here Z Z is an here

item.title: Tools & Resources
item.description: Qualitative Zotero is a free and open-source reference management software to manage bibliographic data and related research materials. ATLAS.ti is a powerful workbench for the qualitative analysis of large bodies of textual, graphical, audio and video data. Grammarly is a cloud-based English-language writing-enhancement platform.. Grammarly's proofreading and plagiarism-detection resources check against more than 250 grammar rules Qantitative R is the statistical programming language we will use in this class. We will interface with R using RStudio, a fully feautred IDE.
